humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the right breast contains a 3.2 cm invasive lobular carcinoma (C. Greatest dimension (pT) : 3.2 cm). Therefore, the T stage for this cancer is T2, which is more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage is determined by the size of the primary tumor in the breast. In this report, the right breast has a single focus of invasive lobular carcinoma with a greatest dimension of slightly >0.5 cm, which would correspond to a T1 stage. However, the left breast has a main mass lesion of 3.2 cm in greatest dimension, which corresponds to a T2 stage. Therefore, the overall T stage for this patient is T2, as it is determined by the largest tumor size.
